full_summary:
#### Community Assessment Parole Supervision (CAPS)

**Title**
Community Assessment Parole Supervision (CAPS), Peace River, Alberta

**Contract Information**
Reference Number: cb-17-88204248
Tender Closing Date: 2023-11-01T15:00:00
Amendment Number: 7

**Purpose and Scope**
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) requires the services of an independent contractor to provide case management and community assessment services for offenders on parole in the Peace River area. The contractor will be responsible for managing and supervising offenders under federal jurisdiction, in accordance with the Corrections and Conditional Release Act (CCRA).

**Deliverables**
The contractor must ensure that all legislation and policies related to offender management and supervision are followed in the completion of tasks related to the statement of work. The contractor will be required to maintain accurate records and make entries in the Offender Management System (OMS) as directed by the project authority.

**Responsibilities**
The contractor will be responsible for:

* Monitoring and assessing the risk level of offenders under their supervision
* Identifying and reporting any changes in an offender's risk level or behavior
* Conducting regular meetings with offenders to monitor their progress and provide support
* Maintaining accurate and up-to-date records of offender activities and behavior
* Collaborating with CSC staff and other stakeholders to ensure the successful reintegration of offenders into the community

**Evaluation Criteria**
The contractor's performance will be evaluated based on their ability to meet the requirements of the contract, including:

* Compliance with CCRA and CSC policies
* Accuracy and timeliness of record keeping
* Effectiveness in managing and supervising offenders
* Collaboration with CSC staff and other stakeholders

**Eligibility and Selection Criteria**
The eligible contractor must have the necessary experience and qualifications to provide case management and community assessment services. The contractor must also have a good understanding of the CCRA and CSC policies and procedures.
